Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Warfare \War"fare`\, n. [War + OE. fare a journey, a passage, course, AS. faru. See {Fare}, n.] [1913 Webster] 1. Military service; military life; contest carried on by enemies; hostilities; war. [1913 Webster]
The Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel. --I Sam. xxviii. 1. [1913 Webster]
This day from battle rest; Faithful hath been your warfare. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. Contest; struggle. [1913 Webster]
The weapons of our warfare are not carnal. --2 Cor. x. 4. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Warfare \War"fare`\, v. i. To lead a military life; to carry on continual wars. --Camden. [1913 Webster]

warfare n 1: the waging of armed conflict against an enemy; "thousands of people were killed in the war" [syn: {war}] 2: an active struggle between competing entities; "a price war"; "a war of wits"; "diplomatic warfare" [syn: {war}]
